newsitem.title: PERU: Peru arrests Czech for smuggling animals.
newsitem.headline: Peru arrests Czech for smuggling animals.

text.p: Customs officials said they arrested a Czech man on Tuesday for trying to smuggle exotic animals out of Peru, while three Chileans and a Spaniard were detained with more than 22 pounds (10 kg) of cocaine.
The five men were arrested as they were about to board a KLM flight to Amsterdam at Lima's Jorge Chavez airport.

Czech citizen Ales Havelka, 27, confessed to trying to spirit out 35 animals of endangered species, customs officials said. Two boas, 17 monkeys, 10 mata-mata turtles, five midget crocodiles and a lizard were found drugged and stuffed in plastic containers inside a suitcase, they added.
Under Peruvian law, conviction for smuggling endangered animals carries a three- to four-year prison sentence.

The four nabbed on drug possession charges said they did not know each other although, according to customs, they were smuggling the drugs in the same way -- in bags taped to their bodies and in the soles of their shoes.

Customs anti-narcotics officers said they detained Chilean citizens German Vereceli, 54, with 6.1 pounds (2.7 kg) of cocaine; Mario Valadares, 64, with 5.6 pounds (2.5 kg); and Juan Stumf, 24, with 5.2 pounds (2.3 kg). Spanish citizen Jose Mora, 72, was arrested with 5.2 pounds (2.3 kg).
